Container.Name: CloudBerryBackup
Container.Overview: Backup files and folders to cloud storage of your choice: Amazon S3, Azure Blob Storage, Google Cloud Storage, HP Cloud, Rackspace Cloud Files, OpenStack, DreamObjects and other. [br][br] The GUI of the application is accessed through a modern web browser (no installation or configuration needed on client side) or via any VNC client. Also, being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small (less than 60MB in download size). [br][br][span][/span] For a complete documentation of this container, see [a href="https://github.com/jlesage/docker-cloudberry-backup/blob/master/README.md"] https://github.com/jlesage/docker-cloudberry-backup/blob/master/README.md[/a].

[font size=4][center]CloudBerry Backup Change Log[/center][/font] [font size=3][b]v1.3.1[/b][/font] (2017-06-22) - Now using baseimage v1.4.3, which brings the following changes: - Updated Alpine Linux to version 3.6.2.
[font size=3][b]v1.3.0[/b][/font] (2017-06-22) - Switched to Alpine Linux 3.6 baseimage.
[font size=3][b]v1.2.0[/b][/font] (2017-06-21) - Upgraded CloudBerry Backup to version 2.0.2.39. - Now using baseimage v1.4.2, which brings the following changes (from last used version): - Associate the application's icon to a unique version to avoid browser cache issues. - Fixed prefix of some service related messages. - Added support for supplying supplementary groups of the application. - Improved process startup and shutdown. - When container is stopped or restarted, processes are now terminated gracefully and in proper order. This allow the GUI application to execute its termination routine. - No more error messages when container is stopped or restarted.
[font size=3][b]v1.1.2[/b][/font] (2017-05-30) - Now using baseimage v1.3.2, which brings the following changes: - Fixed password modal window not showing up when required.
[font size=3][b]v1.1.1[/b][/font] (2017-05-17) - Now using baseimage v1.3.1, which brings the following changes: - Better font is used.
[font size=3][b]v1.1.0[/b][/font] (2017-05-15) - Now using baseimage v1.3.0, which brings the following changes: - Added support for application's niceness configuration.
[font size=3][b]v1.0.3[/b][/font] (2017-05-12) - Now using baseimage v1.2.3, which brings the following changes: - Adjusted the default display width to 1280 pixels, as documented.
[font size=3][b]v1.0.2[/b][/font] (2017-05-11) - Now using baseimage v1.2.2, which brings the following changes: - Fixed issue with the web UI, where the remote application's window was not taking the available height after activating/deactivating the hideable navigation bar.
[font size=3][b]v1.0.1[/b][/font] (2017-05-10) - Now using baseimage v1.2.1, which brings the following changes: - Fixed issue where clipboard content was lost on modal window closure.
[font size=3][b]v1.0.0[/b][/font] (2017-05-09) - Initial release.

Config.Name: Config Directory
Config.Description: This is where the application stores its configuration, log and any files needing persistency.<br>Container path: /config

Config.Name: Storage
Config.Description: This location contains files from your host that need to be accessible by the application.<br>Container path: /storage

Config.Name: Flash
Config.Description: This is where data on your unRAID flash device is located. Useful to backup your unRAID configuration.<br>Container path: /flash

Config.Name: User ID
Config.Description: ID of the user the application runs as.

Config.Name: Group ID
Config.Description: ID of the group the application runs as.

Config.Name: Display Width
Config.Description: Width (in pixels) of the application's window.

Config.Name: Display Height
Config.Description: Height (in pixels) of the application's window.

Config.Name: Niceness (priority)
Config.Description: Priority at which the application should run. A niceness value of -20 is the highest priority and 19 is the lowest priority.<br><b>NOTE:</b> Setting a negative value requires additional permissions. Thus, <i><b>--cap-add=SYS_NICE</b></i> must be added in <i>Extra Parameters</i> (shown when <i>Advanced View</i> is enabled).

Config.Name: WEB Port for GUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI via the web interface.

Config.Name: VNC Port for GUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the application's GUI via the VNC protocol.<br>Make sure this port is equal to the WEB GUI port + 100.
